item.title: The Asia Pacific region is experiencing the most rapid growth for SWIFT
item.description: SWIFT, a financial messaging service, has announced a significant increase in new corporate clients from the Asia Pacific region between May and December 2015, with 29 new companies joining the network. SWIFT provides a unified platform for corporations to communicate financial information with their banks globally, leading to enhanced visibility and more efficient treasury operations. This connection allows for greater automation and standardization of financial processes. Currently, over 1,500 corporate groups, representing roughly 30,000 entities, utilize SWIFT to manage their banking relationships worldwide.

item.title: Choose from a variety of MICE packages available in Southeast Asia
item.description: Three travel companies — Chōsen, The Slate, and Samujana — have designed productivity programs for businesses and workgroups. These programs offer a variety of environments to help teams achieve their best results. For adventure junkies Source: Chosen website. A view of Bali. Chōsen provides experiences tailored for teams that thrive on new adventures and challenges: Activities include cliff jumping, canyoning, surfing, and cooking classes. Accommodation is available at their estate in Bali and other locations, including New Zealand.

item.title: The Singapore Gifts Show will be running until July 11th
item.description: The Singapore Gifts Show 2014 (SGS), now in its ninth year, will focus on showcasing products designed in Singapore and local businesses. The show, supported by the DesignSingapore Council, will feature many Singapore-made gifts, including a new gift and souvenir line called Now & Then. Celcem, led by designer and Singaporean entrepreneur Edwin Low, owner of the local retail boutique Supermama, spearheads this new label. Low, the recipient of the President’s Design Award in 2013, runs Supermama, the studio responsible for the President’s Design Award’s ‘Singapore Icons’ souvenir collection.

item.title: Flight Experience Singapore and McGallen & Bolden offer unique leadership workshops that stand out from the rest
item.description: Source: McGallen & Bolden. Flight Experience Singapore, the first flight simulator open to the public in Asia, has partnered with the consulting firm McGallen & Bolden to offer leadership workshops. Their program, Leadership Secrets at 30,000 Feet, is designed for business leaders and executives. It uses a realistic cockpit setting to teach leadership skills. The customized, four-hour workshop draws on decades of experience from Captain Michael Caston, a pilot with experience flying Boeing 747 and 737 jets for British Airways and Singapore Airlines.

item.title: Come to Singapore Gifts Show 2015 for a wide selection of corporate gifts
item.description: The upcoming Singapore Gifts Show (SGS) 2015 is the ideal event to discover this year’s corporate gift trends. Taking place from July 8th to 10th at Suntec Singapore, Halls 401 to 403, this international trade event offers free admission. It showcases innovative gifts, premiums, and lifestyle products and services, catering to trade buyers and corporate attendees. Celebrating its 10th anniversary, SGS 2015 will host 160 booths featuring exhibitors from the Philippines, Malaysia, Sri Lanka, Thailand, and Singapore.

item.title: Businesses have the opportunity to take part in the For a Golden Home charity campaign
item.description: Cromly.com, a design portal and social media platform, has launched “For a Golden Home.” This online charity campaign aims to improve the lives of needy elderly individuals in Singapore this Chinese New Year. The platform allows organizations to create their own fundraising projects in support of this shared goal. Source: Cromly.com. Participating companies can create a pledge project to raise funds. Eunice Olsen and Paul Foster are ambassadors for the “For a Golden Home” campaign.

item.title: Choose Knots & Gifts for your online gifting needs in Singapore
item.description: Knots & Gifts is a newly established online platform offering a curated selection of gifts, including fresh pastries, cakes, and breads from Singapore’s best bakeries. The platform also features beverages crafted by mixologist Michael Chen, along with home spa services, flowers, and scents. Source: Knots & Gifts. The Mini Tea Party Set, S$78. To order, choose Munchies from the menu at the top. Singaporean entrepreneur Rubina Tiyu created this personalized service after adapting her wedding planning business, Inside the Knot, to the e-commerce landscape during the pandemic.

item.title: Signature Market offers Chinese New Year corporate gifts for Malaysia
item.description: Signature Market is offering corporate gift bundles for the Lunar New Year, starting from RM30, with a focus on wellness. The “Chinese New Year 2023 Collection” features festive packaging adorned with lucky symbols like the number eight, pistachio nuts, mandarin oranges, and spring flowers. Special edition sets come in an exclusive festive box sleeve. Signature Market can advise companies on creating gift packages and offers bulk discounts. They provide over 700 product options and custom packaging solutions.

item.title: du offers corporate mobile plans for SMEs in the UAE
item.description: Du offers five corporate mobile plans designed for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). These plans include data and free calls to colleagues within the business. Ranging from AED 50 to AED 450 per month, the plans provide data, national calling minutes, national text messages, and free calls to numbers within a designated ‘business calling circle’. Three of the plans also include free international minutes and texts. Businesses can purchase additional ‘packs’ to add more minutes, texts, or members to their calling circle.

item.title: The Canon PhotoMarathon is scheduled to take place in Singapore in November
item.description: Source: Canon eDM. Now in its 12th year, the Canon PhotoMarathon 2014 is the biggest photography competition in the region. Taking place in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Vietnam, India, Thailand, and Cambodia, the competition offers a fantastic chance for companies to form teams and compete in the Corporate Challenge category. Companies can participate by assembling a team of at least three individuals who register as a group. In contrast to the open and student divisions, corporate teams are evaluated collectively.

item.title: KPMG has identified gaps in global corporate responsibility reports
item.description: A 2015 KPMG study reveals inconsistencies in how the world’s largest companies report their carbon emissions, making it challenging to compare their performance. While 80% of the top 250 companies address carbon in their reports, the information provided varies significantly. For instance, only half declare carbon reduction goals, and among those, two-thirds don’t explain their rationale. The reported emissions types also differ. Most companies (84%) report emissions from their operations and purchased power (79%), but only half include supply chain emissions.

item.title: In India, Swarn Amrit produces sweets made with edible gold
item.description: Swarn Amrit, a high-end confectionery brand, has introduced a first-of-its-kind product line in India: sweets made with real 24-karat gold. The company believes that gold symbolizes purity, prosperity, and good fortune, and even suggests it may promote longevity. Swarn Kalash The new collection features a variety of sweets with names like kalash, mukhi, madhu, yukti, and katak, representing both Indian and international flavors. For example, Swarn Mukhi layers cashews, almonds, pistachios, and gold, while Swarn Madhu combines Belgian chocolate with gold, and Swarn Katak adds a touch of gold to Turkish delight.

item.title: CulinaryOn Singapore is offering Lunar New Year dinner experiences
item.description: Source: Culinaryon Singapore. Yusheng with salmon sashimi. For this Lunar New Year, CulinaryOn Singapore is offering special dinners starting on December 26th, 2017. These dinners feature premium six-to-eight course meals and include a taste of their cooking classes with a noodle-making activity. Guests can also choose to create their own desserts. The eight-course premium menu features dishes such as yusheng with salmon sashimi, shiitake mushrooms with broccoli, crayfish braised longevity noodles, golden shrimp with honeydew mayo, and mango ice cream with pomelo.

item.title: Australian businesses have the option to utilize uChoose for their corporate rewards program
item.description: Source: uChoose website. i2c, a company providing card processing and new financial service solutions, partnered with Corporate Prepaid Solutions (CPS), a prepaid program manager, to launch the first of several corporate prepaid programs. This launch features the uChoose corporate rewards gift card in Australia. The uChoose card, enabled by i2c’s global processing platform, is a ready-made solution for companies wanting to provide a Visa-branded gift card. Businesses can personalize the card to match their branding.

item.title: Preview of Singapore Gifts Show 2015
item.description: The Singapore Gifts Show (SGS) 2015, held from July 8th to 10th at Suntec Singapore, presented a diverse selection of uniquely Singaporean gifts. A sample pack from organizer TTG Events included the NYP Postcard Set, SG50 Tattoos, Makan Buddies LEGO Minifig, Miniature Tea Book – Volume II, and a Suction Mug. Makan Buddies LEGO Minifig (Graceland Gifts, Booth B21) These personalized LEGO figures demonstrate the potential for designing and 3D printing unique minifigures, as they are known by LEGO enthusiasts.
